New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first game-ending grand slam in World Series history
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe grounded into a fielder's choice to shortstop, scoring Jazz Chisholm Jr. from third after he stole two bases, to give the Yankees a 3-2 lead
Oswaldo Cabrera knocked down the ball with his glove, but it leaked into the outfield
Post-Match Reflections: Freeman said, 'Actually felt pretty good... ankle's good.'
Freeman said, 'I was just screaming in his face. I'm sorry, dad...'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freeman homered on the first pitch he saw â€” an inside fastball from Nestor Cortes
In this much-hyped, star-studded World Series between two of baseball's most storied and successful franchises, Game 1 certainly delivered.
It was the third straight Series opener to go extra innings.
Others: Yankees manager Aaron Boone went to his bullpen again for Cortes, a lefty starter who hadn't pitched since Sept. 18 because of an elbow injury.
